page.title: 19WEST CLEVELAND FROM THE AIR
page.content: cont. from page l8 We were{2,000 to 2,500 feet above {ground level,}looking down on what seemed to be a model village. We could see the{River Tees}meandering around the cramped Yarm houses and shops, lining the High Street. We could just see a few moving cars. Neat, compact clumps of{trees}were scattered around the district, with {farms and fields}nearby. The colours ranged from yellow-browns to various greens, depending on the crops being grown. The strong winds had a rippling effect on the long grasses. As we travelled further North, we saw our school sports field and the {railway.}In the distance were blocks of flats with the{Cleveland Hills} rising behind them. Even at this height, we could still see an interesting range of land uses.
